moves.1. e4: This is an opening e4 that I used to use all of the time, until TA suggested I start developing the d4 line.
moves.1... g6: Since I'm playing someone who will definetly win, why not play something that I can possible learn from or at least explore something different.
moves.2. d4: looks like he taking a stong hold on the center.
moves.2... e6: I will play somekind of primitive pawn development game.
moves.3. c4: White is playing pawn development also, but I feel he is really just opening his forces.
moves.3... c5: purely reactionary move on my part.
moves.4. d5: he looks to be trying to establish an advance pawn structure, forcing me into a closed game.
moves.4... exd5: I try and redirect where the pawns end up at.
moves.5. cxd5: anticipated, it does open the door for the dark bishop.
moves.5... d6: trying to regroup a stronger pawn structure, I'm hoping I'm not wasting to many moves at the cost of other piece development.
moves.6... Bg7: time to get the dark bishop out.
moves.8. Nd2: something I wouldn't usually do, normally play more aggressive. I would assume he is planning on where he wants this knight to end up at.
moves.8... Nbd7: this is better than the edge of the board.
moves.9. Be2: not sure where he is going with that move, maybe a move to set up castling.
moves.9... b6: try and develop a pawn structure wall on the queen side.
moves.10. Nc4: with the game tending towards closed structure, I knew blacks knights would play an important role.
moves.10... Qc7: not to sure why I made this move, probably ke5 would have been better, I think must have made this move while thinking about something else.
moves.11. Nb5: I'm paying the price of that last move, white is jump on the opportunity offered up to him.
moves.11... Qb7: wrong move, in hindsight, maybe Qb8 would have been better.
moves.12. Nbxd6+: don't have to worry about the bad Queen move she is gone now.
moves.12... Kd8 13. Nxb7+ Kc7: All out of position now this game will truely be rough to finish.
moves.14. Nbd6:
preparing to pick me apart, to the victor goes the spoils.*****************************************************************************
*****
*
~~~~~therealjimfriar: Sounds good. One good tip is always to recapture if you can. If I capture a piece you retake unless theres a better move...
moves.14... Nb8: I'm so rattled at this tage I give the taking of the knight and set him up for somethin else.
moves.15... a6 16. Nxf7+: gains a pawn, will gain a rook, the knight id look pretty strong here as it slices and dices.
moves.16... Kb7 17. Qb3: seems white has mercy on me, maybe, maybe he sees something better!
moves.17... b5: try to get rid of the knight, and strengthen my position, knowing this leads to another possible check.
moves.18. Nfd6+: anticipated, but I figured he would grab the rook while he was there???
moves.19. Nxb5+: This doesn't look good, I know enough when you have knights working in tandem, with backup support from the Queen, it will not last much longer.
moves.19... Kb7: Hoping for a mistake, I doubt I will see that....
moves.20. Nd4+: Mate pending, I have enjoyed the game.

gameName: Walking the Walk & Learning to Run Welcome MT Pt.8
